fact: First discovered in 1889 by Othniel Charles Marsh
The skull of a Triceratops alone could grow over 2m (7ft) in length
The Triceratops was a plant eating (herbivore) dinosaur
The largest known skull measures in at 5 feet long.
The name Tyrannosaurus Rex comes from Greek and Latin words meaning ‘Tyrant Lizard King’.
The terrific T. Rex was a seriously big beast, growing up to 12m long and 6m tall!
Anklyosaurus survived for approximately 135 million years.
The name Ankylosaurus means ‘fused lizard
Ankylosaurus were herbivores (plant eaters) and had small teeth relative to their body size
An asteroid was named 9954 Brachiosaurus in 1991.
The Brachiosaurus walked on all four legs
The length of Brachiosaurus is believed to have been around 26 metres (85 feet).
The Stegosaurus had between 17 and 22 seperate places and flat spines.
The Stegosaurus was alive in the late Jurassic Period (around 150 million years ago).
The Stegosaurus also featured tail spikes that reached around 60cm (2ft) to 90cm (3ft) in length.
Elasmosaurus was a marine reptile first discovered in Kansas.
The meaning of its name is Thin Plated Lizard
They were slow swimmers
Actually a flying reptile, the Pteranodon is not a dinosaur.
They lived in the Late Cretaceous period, about 85-75 million years ago.
Fossils have been found in Kansas, USA, North America and in England, Europe.
All birds are living dinosaurs.
